thread.title: Top 10 Greatest Dad Riffs Of All Time (Played On The Official Dad Guitar) [News]
thread.title_full: Top 10 Greatest Dad Riffs Of All Time (Played On The Official Dad Guitar) [News]

title: Top 10 Greatest Dad Riffs Of All Time (Played On The Official Dad Guitar) [News]
text:
Top 10 Greatest Dad Riffs of All Time (Played on the Official Dad Guitar) So, what's your dad level? Posted 11 hours ago 0 
In his new video, guitar instructor Robert Baker offered a set of Top 10 greatest dad riffs of all time. 
The dude even offered the dad test above for you to take if you're up for it. 
Anyhow, the list of ultimate dad riffs reads as follows, make sure to watch the video for the whole thing. 10 Greatest dad riffs ever 
Scorpions - Rock You Like a Hurricane AC/DC - Thunderstruck Deep Purple - Smoke on the Water ZZ Top - La Grange Lynyrd Skynyrd - Sweet Home Alabama So, what's your dad level? 11 hours ago in Features , 18 comments 6 13 hours ago in Music news , 3 comments 12 14 hours ago in Features , 83 comments Trending stories 3 7 hours ago in Music news , 17 comments 7 10 hours ago in Features , 175 comments 14 41 comments sorted by best / new / date B I became a dad when I was 12, apparently. 79 Milo Yiannopoulos? Is that you? 8 That was below the belt. 0 Sex tends to happen that way... 8 You may have taken my power chords joke man, but geez... 0 Since when ''Dad riffs'' are a thing? I'm spending too much time in real life it seems. 18 Well that was fucking stupid. 8 In 30 years I wonder what the kids will be listening to when "Dad Rock" consists of bands like Lamb of God and Rage Against the Machine. 8 This would be more accurate if they replaced all 10 riffs with Stevie Ray Vaughn riffs. 9 It's funny, but what people call "dad rock", I call " good rock", much of which I wish I'd discovered as a teenager. Has anyone considered that your taste in music just improves as you get older? 5 I just call it classic rock. Another dumb title. 1 Thanks for the list ug. Now I dont have to watch that video. 3 Bit odd Paradise City is on the list but Sweet Child O' Mine isn't, easily the most dad riiff here in Straya 4 Dad Rock nah, that's like "Reeling in the Years" by Steely Dan or "Twenty five or Six to Four" by Chicago. 2 Carry on my wayward son! South Park! 1 Should've added "Carry On My Wayward Son" just for the South Park reference 1 travislausch [w] 3,395 · 7 hours ago · permalink · ↑ reply "More Than a Feeling" for sure. Probably "Day Tripper"-Beatles and something by George Thorogood as well. 0 I was thinking more "Peace Of Mind" but yeah literally any riff from the first three Boston records will do. 0 travislausch [w] 3,395 · 52 minutes ago · permalink · ↑ reply Daytripper - Beatles Satisfaction - Rolling Stones 1 The Boys Are Back in Town deserves an honorable mention. 1 lifeinshambles 90 · 9 hours ago · permalink · ↑ reply Erm, what? My dad's "dad riffs" would be: Pink Floyd - wish you were here Led zeppelin - stairway to heaven Lionel Ritchie - hello The Beatles - and i love her Buddy holly - words of love Etc. GnR, AC/DC, etc are "too heavy" lmao 0 So if you played Guitar Hero a few years ago when you were 12 and liked the songs and learned them you are a dead, seems legit 1 I gotta show this to my kid... he's gona laugh his ass off.. 0 Not sure how you can include Paradise City. Im pretty sure Slash himself has said the main riff is the hardest to play. 0 Does a dad guitar have a recessed back to accommodate the dad body? 0
